Based on the user's preferences and the list of movies provided, I would recommend watching Scott Pilgrim vs. the World (2010).

This movie features a unique storyline, well-developed characters, and excellent production values.

The plot revolves around Scott Pilgrim (played by Ryan Gosling), who is obsessed with his girlfriend's past relationships, including those involving his own best friend (played by Michael Cera)).

As Scott goes on to discover more about his girlfriend's past relationships, he becomes increasingly conflicted between his loyalty to his girlfriend and his desire for justice and closure for the victims of his girlfriend's past relationships.

Ultimately, as Scott continues to navigate through these conflicting emotions and priorities, he comes to realize that in order to truly love someone, one must also be willing to accept and forgive any flaws or mistakes that they may have made in their own previous relationships.
